body.p: “I followed “,” examining his tracks. There was about a quarter of an inch of recent snow above the crust “,” but for the most part he broke in two or three inches. I slumped from one to three feet. His tracks when running “,” as I have described “,” were like this:--[image] being about two by five inches “,” as if he slid a little “,” no marks of toes being seen in that shallow snow; the greatest interval above “,” one foot.”
PE 10, pg. 176 / 4 January-23 April 1856 / NNPM MA 1302:26 / T vol. # XX / PDF # XIV / JVIII
